kakhil26 wrote:
> hi all!
> i am trying to run a junit test that is used to test the method
> Math.round() in java.lang.Math.I am trying to run this test on
> Rational XDE Developer plus for java (version 2002-2003).Here's a
> glimpse of a test method written for it:
> 
> public void testRoundfloat()
>       {       int d ;
>             Float f = new Float(32.4);
>            
>             d=Math.round(f);
>             assertEquals(32,d);
>       }
> 
> But the tool gives a  compilation error .here is the exact
> description of the error:
> The method round(float)is not applicable for the arguments (Float);
> I would like to point out that i have run this test successfully on
> the command prompt using jdk1.5.0.

float is a primitive type and Float is a class. I recommend you search 
the web for some good Java tutorials, because this is an elementary Java 
question, and nothing to do with JUnit. You're using JUnit fine, but you 
need to learn a little more Java.

To fix the test, do this:

public void testRoundFloat() {
     assertEquals(32, Math.round(32.4f));
}

I suspect that will work, although I didn't bother to try to compile it. 
(I'm lazy.)

Good luck.
--
